alert.note: Alert for Fall River County Area; Southern Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 18 at 2:51AM MDT until September 19 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .Unseasonably warm temperatures are expected Monday. With very dry air in place, minimum relative humidity will drop below 15 percent for portions of northeast Wyoming and southwest South Dakota and range from 15 to 22 percent for the remainder of western South Dakota. Wind gusts of 20 to 30 mph are possible for portions of northeast Wyoming and southwest South Dakota Monday afternoon. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, 317, 321, AND 322... The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 314 Northern Campbell, 315 Southern Campbell, 316 Crook County Plains, 317 Weston County Plains, 321 Southern Black Hills and 322 Fall River County Area. * WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Fall River County Area; Southern Black Hills
